Sebastien Lambla wrote (in
<http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/rest-discuss=
/message/11197>):

> Please advise if I missed a fundamental point.

You mi=
ssed "Overview of URIs"
(<http://gbiv.com/protocols/uri/rfc/rfc3986.html#ov=
erview>), section 1.1
of RFC 3986:

"A URI is an identifier consisting of a=
 sequence of characters matching
the syntax rule named <URI> in Section 3."=


And then you missed the ABNF production rules scattered throughout the
RF=
C and collected in "Collected ABNF for URI"
(<http://gbiv.com/protocols/uri=
/rfc/rfc3986.html#collected-abnf>),
appendix A of RFC 3986.

Have you read =
my message in
<http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/rest-discuss/message/1119=
3>? Did you
manage to produce from grammar G a string containing U+003C, U+=
003E,
U+007B, or U+007D? If so, which sequence of production rules did you
=
use?

-- 
Please do not include my address in public replies. I will read p=
ublic
replies on the list.
